search_author(name: str)[source]¶

Search by author name and return a generator of Author objects

search_author_custom_url(url: str)[source]¶

Search by custom URL and return a generator of Publication objects URL should be of the form ‘/citation?q=…’

Search by keyword and return a generator of Author objects

Search by custom URL and return a generator of Publication objects URL should be of the form ‘/scholar?q=…’

search_pubs_query(query: str)[source]¶

property session¶
property use_proxy¶

Gets use proxy value

[description] :returns: a boolean indicating if proxy is being used :rtype: {bool}

scholarly.Scholarly.get_scholarly_instance(use_proxy: bool = True, use_selenium: bool = True, browser: str = 'chrome') → scholarly.Scholarly.Scholarly[source]¶

Returns Selenium or Session version of Scholarly

Parameters

  • use_proxy (bool, optional) – whether or not to use a proxy, defaults to False

  • use_selenium (bool, optional) – wether or not to use Selenium, defaults to True

  • browser (str, optional) – browser to be used [chrome, firefox], defaults to ‘chrome’

scholarly.Publication module¶

class scholarly.Publication.Publication(_Publication__data, scholarly, pubtype=None)[source]¶

Returns an object for a single publication

property bibtex¶

Contains the publication as a bibtex entry

Returns

str – a bibtex entry

fill()[source]¶

Populate the Publication with information from Google Scholar

Please notice that this information is not truly reliable because Google Scholar might not have all authors and contains different versions of the same publication
